instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the detection model in the detection of pesticide residue on bok choi?

The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the detection model was the F1-score. The F1-score is a measure of a model's accuracy that takes into account both precision and recall. It is the harmonic mean of precision and recall, and it provides a balanced assessment of the model's performance.

The F1-score can range from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best possible score. A higher F1-score indicates better performance in terms of correctly identifying positive samples (samples with pesticide residue) and correctly identifying negative samples (samples without pesticide residue). In this study, the model achieved a satisfactory F1-score of 100%, indicating that it performed very well in detecting chlorpyrifos residue on bok choi.

It is important to note that while the F1-score is a useful metric for evaluating the model's performance, it does not provide information about the model's ability to generalize to new, unseen data. Therefore, further testing and validation would be necessary to assess the model's robustness and generalizability beyond the specific dataset used in this study.
